Mikko Laurikkala ja muut ohjaajat

Thank you for the feedback. I was very happy to read it! I will be more precise with what is compulsory and what is not the next time. I agree it was not completely clear if the draft version of the final report was compulsory or not. Next time it will be. Thank you. Happy future!

Tarkoitus on edelleen pitää kurssia työpajatyyppisenä ja vuorovaikutteisena.

name: Synthetic Biology: Design of a New Device

instances.response: Thank you.
Thanks for the very positive feedback. There were no suggestions for development, but then again, the projects tend to be highly individual.
Kiitos palautteesta. Ilmeisesti asiat sujuivat ihan OK.
Kiitos hyvästä ja rakentavasta palautteesta. Sitä hyödynnetään opintojakson kehittämisessä.

I already commented the two most important issues that was brought up in the written feedback: number of credits versus workload and close deadlines of this course and RF Project. Also there is a short comment on the question "Were the learning outcomes of the course clear to me at the beginning of the course?"
Thank you for the feedback. It was very interesting to read it. I have taken actions based on your answers to "How would you develop the course?"
Thank you!
Only one student gave feedback via Kaiku. (S)he was very happy with the course --- gave the highest possible mark and in the verbal part wrote very positive feedback.

You gave one 3, three 4, and one 5 for the overall grade of the course, making the average 4. The distribution was the same to how well the course supported the learning objectives. Everybody felt that the workload was right.

There were some suggestions how to improve the course, but nothing very strong. Perhaps the clearest message to me is that I should always tell the next week's problems on the course web page instead of trusting that students hear it at the lectures or ask from each other. Also it should be more transparent where the points came from and how they contributed to the mark. On the other hand, this non-transparency is at least partially a consequence of the flexible and interactive way of running the course, and many comments said that the style of the course was much better than the traditional lectures + strictly formatted problems.

Kiitos palautteesta!
Mielelläni ottaisin kurssille oppikirjan mutta nykyistä sisältöä on yhdestä kirjasta vaikea löytää. Ainakin täytyy paremmin mainita lähde josta kalvoilla kerrotun asian voi lukea.
Tehtäviä muotoilen aina muutamia uusia vuodessa. Tehtävissä yritän löytää sopivan tasapainon haasteille,  vinkkien antamiselle ja mahdollisuudelle tarkistaa tehtävä.

Hi,

Thanks for the feedback! 
I try to develop the course and especially the topics a bit each year within the time frame of other duties. We shall try to aling the topics better with other optics/photonics/physics courses. Now this course has a bit broad range of topics which makes it problematic to find a suitable course book. Some of the lecture notes also need updating as you also observed. 

In Matlab exercises the balance from the viewpoint of the teacher is how to give enough clues that everybody can do the tasks without previous Matlab experience but still provide enough challenge. It is also for me easer to evaluate the exercise from my own code. Perhaps you observed that its easy to make a tiny mistake which takes hours to find without any benefit to understand the topic itself.

Regards,
Tapio

Thank's for the feedback! 
The overall impression is that the evaluations are good. I shall try to clarify the the contents and the course material in the coming years. Development of the exercises and search for an appropriate book is on my to do list.

You evaluated the number of credit points as suitable but only spent 85 learning hours which corresponds to 3.3 credits? This is probably a sign that the exercises were made in the exercise hours and not in your own time? 

The course will be lectured in one period in the future so this might change naturally. Participation in lectures was better throughout the course than in many years. It was nice to notice!

Participation in the exercises has been useful since we have discussed the approach to the exercises extensively.

The overall impression of the exam was that is appeared to be more difficult than I thought. We did not calculate any Fabry-Perot problem in the exercises and that was somehow visible in the answers.

The future is clearly the e-exam. It was used for the first time now but seems to be a potential option. Some careful thinking of what kind of exercises are used is needed since any derivation of equations is problematic. I realized this while making the exercises but could not avoid it completely. Most likely Matlab templates will be used also in e-exams in the future.
Thank you for your feedback and suggestions. I will certainly take them into account when planning future implementations of the course.

Thank you for your course feedback and valuable suggestions. It might not be possible to give the course more space in the schedule, but the idea about the group project at the end is worth considering. I have given you a lot of freedom about the final essay topic choice, but since some would have wanted more precision about this, I will try to narrow it down next time. At least for those who wish this. There are always some who are less talkative than others, but hopefully everyone at least had a chance to say what they wanted. I do not think it is possible to be too talkative, provided one is ready to listen too. This course would not work without people who have thoughts and are ready to share them. I really enjoyed the discussions, and want to thank you all for your contributions. I learned quite a bit, hope you did too.

Thank you very much for your encouraging feed back. And thank you also for making the course what it was - most of its success depends on your enthusiasm and willingness to exchange ideas and comment on the readings. You were an excellent discussion group!

Thank you for your feed back. It was an interesting course to the teacher as well, since so much depends on what you want to talk about and what are your research interests. Your willingness to exchange ideas and comment on the readings, even share links related to the issues, was very important. I am confident that courses similar to this will be included in the curriculum in the future.

Thank you for your feedback, it will certainly help when future course implementations are planned. This is always an interesting course to the teacher as well, since so much depends on what you want to talk about and what are your interests. Your enthusiasm to share experiences and ideas prompted by the week’s text was very important. The curriculum will change next year, but most likely courses similar to this will be available in the future as well.

Thank you for the positive feedback! We have been able to extend the number of topics and now in the spring implementation we had 21 topics. A wish for more time for the execution of the project was again stated. That is rather difficult to realize since the implementation has already been designed so that the whole length of the two periods is in use.
Thank you for the positive feedback! There is a very good point below (open questions section) about the presentations. We will try to instruct the students better in that respect in future.
Thank you for the very positive feedback!

Thank you for the positive feedback! More choice for the topics was wished for and we are also aiming for a comprehensive list. However, the variation is quite large from one implementation to another since the clients are volunteers from the department and occasionally from companies.

Thank you for the very positive feedback! One aspect that was brought up in the course feedback given in final reports, was a wish for receiving more positive feedback from the reports, i.e. getting the feedback of what is good in the reports in addition to the required corrections. I will put more emphasis on this positive feedback in future implementations.

Kiitos palautteesta!

Verkko-opinnot vaativat aivan omanlaistaan panostusta myös opiskelijalta. Lähiopetuksessa voi välittömästi kysyä täsmennystä tai syventää teemaa alustajan ja muiden osallistujien kanssa. Verkkojaksolla usein opiskelija tekee itse tämän selvitystyön oma-aloitteisesti ja näin syventää oppimistaan omista tarpeistaan käsin. Näin näyttäisi myös palautteen perusteella tapahtuneen. Eli osoittaa opiskelijoilta kykyä itsenäiseen työskentelyyn ja vastuunkantoon.

Palaute on toimitettu myös opintojaksoa toteuttavan Tulevaisuudentutkimuksen verkostoakatemian koulutussuunnittelijalle, joka ottaa tässä tulleen palautteen sekä muissa yliopistoissa kerätyn palautteen huomioon suunnittelussa ja tulevissa toteutuksissa. Aiheellinen palaute joidenkin äänitteiden osalta otetaan huomioon.

Kiitos palautteesta! Tällä Tulevaisuudentutkimuksen verkostoakatemian verkkokurssina järjestämällä opintojaksolla palautetta kerätään systemaattisesti ja sen perusteella kurssia pyritään joka vuosi kehittämään joltain osin. Viimeinen palautuspäivä oli tänä vuonna hieman aikaisemmin, jotta arviointi olisi mahdollista saada valmiiksi ennen joulua ja seuraavan kurssin alkua tammikuussa. Aikataulut pyritään saamaan jatkossa mahdollimman sopiviksi eri opiskelijoille ja kokonaisuuden suorittamisen näkökulmasta.
Thanks for your feedback! Your Kaiku-feedback and your feedback during the course will be taken into account when palnning the next implementation.

Thank you for your feedback! 

We shall check schedule of the antenna courses and their tasks for next Spring, since academic year 2015-2016 the 3rd and 4th periods have 7 weeks (instead of 8 weeks).

Thanks to all who returned feedback. We will be combing through on multiple occasions, but here are some comments regarding the feedback. People are different and prefer different kinds of approaches. On general level Demola was seen to be an interesting opportunity to gain experience and earn credits. The worh load was critizised to both directions, this depends always on so many variables (individual situation, team, case organization, to name but a few) that it is rather difficult to affect this. Something we have to live with. 

We'll try to accommodate the majority of the feedback. The Demola crew is planning to release a new set of guidelines and even some stricter rules for the things to be demanded and how to make things happen. We'll see. The time consumption follow-up was seen to be both motivating and educating by the planning staff. However this turned out to be a bit of a disappointment. Some of you didn't quite grasp the true meaning of this. This is yet another thing we need to go through before the next round. Anyway, thank you for participating and Godspeed!

Thanks for the feedback. Also, thanks for the participation. your feedback will be reviewed and when possible be taken into consideration in further courses.

The practical connection to the world outside the university is appreciated. Rightfully so. It indeed gives more contents and motivation to the whole. 

As the projects are always different their requirements are similarly different. Thus the amount of hours one needs to put in, vary greatly. Time is always of the essence, so this is rather a given thing. 

I will pass on the feedback to appropriate parties.

Students' comments seem normal. 

All the projects are different, some are smaller and some are larger.

Students' feedback seem normal. 

It is important to get together early and quickly within the group, in any and every project. 

Students from different universities often have different schedules.

Thank you all for your feedback. I am glad to see that for most parts the course was satisfactory to say the least. I do hope that the experience was also able to teach you something. We'll go through the feedback more than once and make adjustments if need be. 

Should any of you have felt a bit left aside, I am again sorry for my personal absence as I was abroad for the whole duration and my stand-in had other previous engagements. 

If the person reporting that not all students received equal opportunity to get the credits care to elaborate, I'd be grateful. Is that some of our doings? Was there indeed a student that couldn't enrol to the course? Or what is meant by this, I'd really like to know.

Thank you for the feedback. 

As you have noticed, Demola organisation and structure of Demola Project Work is changing for 2018, which was a surprise for TUT teachers (and at some level to Demola staff, too). 

So the coordination between TUT and Demola perhaps could not be worse as it was in Autumn 2017.
Thank you for the valuable feedback. The course is undertaking a major change, so it will re-designed to a degree. Your feedback will be taken into account.

name: Advanced Topics in Automation Science and Engineering

instances.response: Four students were motivated and diligent enough to complete this 4-week course. I enjoyed working with them. Their feedback comments are positive. The feedback comments suggest expanding the course; I agree with this recommendation. I may offer the course again if there is demand for it.

As Risto mentioned there is more details report on the course. What I can add here is that the main issue seems to be the group works. We come up with the "exam" idea just to evaluate more carefully the contributions of each group member.
The number of responses is too small to make a reliable inference.

Kiitos palautteestanne. Ensinnäkin kokonaisarvionne kannustaa jatkamaan valitulla linjalla, jossa viestinnän osaamisen käytäntöä ja teoriaa pyritään nivomaan yhteen. Toiseksi palautteistanne voi lukea monia kehittämisideoita, joista osasta keskustelimmekin jo viimeisessä kokoontumisessa tiiviisti. Luentojen vuorovaikutteisuuteen kiinnitetään huomiota jo seuraavalla kurssilla. Samoin puhe-esitysten painotusta on harkittava, esim. monien kaipaamaa ex tempore-esittämistä täytyy niveltää mukaan lisää. Kriittisyyden lisääminen palautteisiin on hyvin herkkä tekijä, josta on vankkaa kokemusperäistä näyttöä.

Hyvät opiskelijat - Kiitos monipuolisista kommenteista. Mikä parasta kaikki vaikuttavat varsin tyytyväisiltä. Teorian ja käytännön yhdistäminen sopivalla tavalla tuntuu toimivan varsin hyvin. Joustavuus harjoitusosallistumisessa on koettu motivoivana myös. Osaamistavoitteet on kokonaisuudessaan saavutettu hyvin, mistä ollaan varmaan pöydän molemmin puolin tyytyväisiä. 
Olette eritelleet hyvin viestinnän, puhe- ja neuvottelutaidon merkitystä osana ammattitaidon kehitystänne. Tulkitsen, että innostus on ollut huipputasoa ja lähes poikkeuksetta myös videotyöt ovat lisänneet viestinnällistä osaamistanne, kuten oli tarkoituskin.
Puutteita on mm. joidenkin harjoitusten tehtävänannoissa, tiedotuksessa ja joissain yksittäisissä havainnoissa. Palautteita myös koetaan yksilöllisesti. Kriittisiä tekijöitä korjataan jatkossa, kun jakson nimeksi muuttuu Esimies- ja johtamisviestintä. Samalla painopiste siirtyy enemmän uuden nimen linjalle.

Thank you for participating Laboratory Course in Bioengineering and giving feedback. The feedback was very positive and according to your answers no critical improvements need to be done for the next year. However, some of you thought that the workload was too high compared to the credits. The total of 5 credits is equivalent to 133 h of work. We will calculate the hours again when we design the laboratory projects for the next implementation. Also the necessity of the seminar session was questioned. It is important to learn to present the results of your work and for that reason it is practised also on this course.

Thank you for participating KEB-23306 and giving constructive course feedback! Based on the high overall grade, the course was very much liked and we are very happy about that. However, some of you thought that the workload on the course was a bit too high compared to the number of credits awarded. We will try to take this into account when organizing the course the next time.

Palautteen ja omien pohdintojeni perusteella olen päätymässä siihen, että lukuvuoden 2015 - 2016 pienellä kurssilla vien osaamisen arviointi -tehtävää ns. dialogitentin suuntaan. Toinen vaihtoehto olisi ollut se, että osaamisen arviointitehtävän sijasta kurssilla otettaisiin käyttöön sähköinen tentti. Täysin poissuljettu tämä vaihtoehto ei ole, jos tulevan kurssin opiskelijat kokevat asian hyväksi. Kuusi opiskelijaa kaipasi vaativampia tehtäviä. Dialogitentti voisi olla vastaus myös tähän toiveeseen. Kurssin siirtyminen lukuvuoden lopusta lukuvuoden alkuun mahdollistaa omalta osaltaan kurssin viemistä enemmän oppimista tukevaan suuntaan.

Palautteen ja omien pohdintojeni perusteella osaamisen arviointi vaatii kehittämistä. Helpoin ratkaisu olisi pisterajojen säätäminen. Tämä on saanut kannatusta opiskelijoilta. Sitäkin pohdin, että osaamisen arviointitehtävän sijasta kurssilla otettaisiin käyttöön sähköinen tentti. Kiitos palautteesta!

Kiitoksia näistä vastauksista! Palautteen perusteella nousee kolme mahdollista kohdetta kehittämiselle: enemmän viikkotehtäviä, muutama vähän haastavampi viikkotehtävä, (luento)tentit Examiin (mahdollisesti osaamisen arviointi -tehtävän vaihtoehdoksi). Jään miettimään näitä ja muita palautteessa ehdotettuja asioita. Esimerkiksi luentoesimerkkien kohdalla ehdotettiin paperitaulukoiden sijasta, tai niiden rinnalla, Excel-tiedostojen jakamista - hyvä ja toteuttamiskelpoinen idea!

Kiitos vastauksista tähän palautekyselyyn! Tällä hetkellä teemme opinto-oppaan yhdeksi vuodeksi eteenpäin. Tiedossa on kuitenkin se, että sitä seuraavan opinto-oppaan pitäisi olla kolmivuotinen. Olen kerännyt parin vuoden ajan ajatuksia ja ideoita, joiden pohjalta järkevien valintojen tekeminen tämän kurssin tulevaisuudesta on mahdollista. Tässä vaiheessa en osaa sanoa, mitä toimenpiteitä juuri näiden vastausten perusteella tehdään ... tai jätetään tekemättä. Se on kuitenkin selvä, että tätä tietoa tarvitaan!

Response to the Feedback in the Course ASE-3076 Microfluidics
Dear Students,
Thank you for your feedback! In this response, you find a summary of the feedback and the main actions planned for improving the next implementation.

Overall Rating 4,57
In general, we consider the implementation in spring 2015 successful: the overall rating was 4,57, the average for the appropriateness to achieve the intended learning outcomes was 4,86 and all of you thought that the workload corresponded with the credits.

In the written feedback, you appreciated especially the laboratory works and the FEM exercise and the way, how the course was scheduled. The improvement suggestions were related to including more calculation exercises and laboratory works, and including a consultation session after the calculation exercises have been completed. 

What to change in the future
Unfortunately, our teaching resources do not currently allow increasing the number of exercise hours. However, including a feedback session is a good idea and it will be considered in the next implementation.

Best regards,

Prof Pasi Kallio and teaching staff of ASE-3076

Dear Students,
Thank you for your feedback! In this response, you find a summary of the feedback and the main actions planned for improving the next implementation.

Overall Rating 4,67
In general, we consider the implementation in spring 2016 very successful: the overall rating was 4,67, the average for the appropriateness to achieve the intended learning outcomes was 4,33 and all of you thought that the workload corresponded with the credits.

In the written feedback, you appreciated especially the laboratory works and the FEM exercise and the way, how the course was scheduled. The improvement suggestions were related to including weekly calculation exercises. Even though the laboratory works were appreciated, they were also considered time consuming. 

What to change in the future
Unfortunately, our teaching resources do not currently allow increasing the number of exercise hours. Our main challenge in this course is to increase its attractiveness such that the number of students can be increased. With the current number of students, we need to consider in which format this course will be given. 

Best regards,

Prof Pasi Kallio and teaching staff of ASE-3076

Response to the Feedback in the Course BMT-3076 Microfluidics

Dear Students,
Thank you for your feedback! In this response, you find a summary of the feedback and the main actions planned for improving the next implementation.

Overall Rating 3,78
In general, we consider the implementation in spring term 2018 relatively successful: the overall rating was 3,78, the average for the appropriateness to achieve the intended learning outcomes was 4,22 and 78% thought that the workload corresponded with the credits.

In the written feedback, you appreciated especially the laboratory works. The lectures and the FEM exercises received also positive comments. The improvement suggestions were related to the number of calculation exercises and arranging an office hour when it would be possible to ask about the exercises. Even though the FEM exercises were appreciated in many feedbacks, some considered them time consuming and challenging. More time, an additional assistant and preliminary works were suggested. Also, harmonizing the symbols used in the course was suggested. 

What to change in the future
In the next implementation round, we will pay attention to the FEM exercises by either splitting the tasks to smaller tasks, having longer joint sessions or defining some of the tasks as preliminary work.

Thank you for the valuable comments and have nice summer time!

Prof Pasi Kallio and teaching staff of BMT-3076

Thank you for constructive feedback! Good feedback always helps to develop/renew the course. 
Main points based on the feedback were: 
1) Most are happy with hands on exercises like FEM and lab sessions. 
--> Seeing phenomenon in practice and working with them usually helps to learn better. Glad to hear people have liked them. 
2) Wetlab instructions have been unclear. 
--> We also noticed this and we will clarify them for the next year.
3) Some alternatives for grading were suggested. 
--> We will check if this is somehow possible.
Opintojaksoa ei ainakaan toistaiseksi tulla jatkossa toteuttamaan. Kurssin aihepiirien järjestystä kannattaa hieman muuttaa siten, että harjoitustyön tekemiseen olisi enemmän aikaa.

Big thanks for everyone for the feedback you gave me. You did much hard work to pass the course. Thanks also for the feedback during the course since some of the assignments had some errors in it which are hard to spot if you have done them yourself. Here is my response to your feedback:


-The workload is quite high compared to other courses since this is one of the few practical courses we have in our department. Therefore, there is no reference where to compare the amount of work you have done. However, I will intend to keep the workload as it is. I believe that learning by doing is the best way to make you better engineers. Yes its tough, but you can expect it to just get more tougher when you graduate.


-I will try to make the task explanations more detailed next year as there were some misunderstandings what to do in each task. This was the first time the course was implemented during two periods do I expected some difficulties like this.



-Passing the course requires some background knowledge on switched-mode converters. Courses DEE-33106 and DEE-34106 are recommended prerequisities. I will consider making the compulsory prerequsities in the following implementations of the course.



-Covering the dynamic properties of a boost converter during one lecture is quite impossible. However, I should have given some time to explain why the capacitor was increased to lower the resonant frequency to 400 Hz. Lowering the resonant frequency by increasing capacitance was essential to make the converter controllable by other than I-type controller.



-I will consider adding some material on the placement of components. I know it is not a trivial task.



-I did not publish the feedback regarding the last question since the feedback was supposed to be anonymous. However, it seemed that most of you learned some new skills or at least were able to strengthen the skills you already have. That is very pleasing to hear. Knowing what exact skills you need in the industry is impossible since the vast variability of topics. However, most propably you will need to learn something you have never done before, e.g., new computer program, new topologies, new materials & components etc. So be prepared to learn anything new that advancing on your future career requires.

Thank you all for the valuable feedback and big thanks for our course assistant MSc Aapo Aapro for managing this year's implementation.

Getting hands-on experience with power electronics is very important and appreciated by employers. We are dedicated to improving all the courses offered by DEE and try to take all comments into account. 

Some issues that shall be fixed before the next term:
-Equipment is poor and we know this. We should invest to a new soldering station and equipment.

-Discussion has been started about giving a grade on the course. However, this is not an easy task since everyone has totally different background and the grade should reflect how much the student has learned and worked during the course. The idea of the course is to emphasize learning essential skills, not improving GPA. However, those who work a lot should be rewarded somehow.

-Control design related to the course should not be too difficult if one has completed DEE-34106 Converter Dynamics and EMC which is a compulsory pre-course. We have to have an internal discussion if the precourse provides enough basis for completing this course. And I also want to stress that power electronics, in fact, is an important application area of control engineering. Nowadays you cannot categorize engineering problems to have a strict field but everything is connected.

-There should be a possibility to make more demanding circuits and more specific tests.

Thank you for the feedback. I will answer instead of Matias and Ammar who were the actual lecturers. Based on my understanding many groups completed the project within the given time and there seemed to be a steady increase in knowledge. I hope you had a good experience and keep on increasing your knowledge and skills in power electronics. Right now it is a good field to be in... 

One student criticized the course of being "ancient". I am not sure what he/she meant. The way the converter looks like depends on the skills of the student, not the assistant or lecturer. Software tools used in the course (PADS & Simulink) are still standard in companies. Moreover, the used DSP is actually quite new and you are likely to see something similar in current power converters. Now, it does not really matter in this course if the MOSFET is old or not. We could use Silicon-Carbide transistors but then most of you would be struggling even more as SiC devices are very fast and likely cause more distortion to your measurement circuit. Moreover, the topology is simple due to a very simple reason: If you cannot get a simple Boost converter to work, you have no hope of building more advanced topologies such as e.g. dual-active bridge or interleaved bi-directional dc-dc converter.

There were some problems with TUTLab, because it was not available as much as we had hoped. Maybe next year we will shift the course back to the department premises.

This year there was a lot of work for Matias and Ammar because the DSP was renewed and a lot of new course material had to be generated and co-operation with TUTLab established. However, thanks for your patience!

Best Regards
Tuomas Messo
Assistant Professor in Power Electronics

We thank you for your participation. 

The statistics to the first questions are visible to you as graphs.

The main issues from the open questions were:

1) The lectures were well liked and the studying style was considered motivating.
2) Oral exams were also considered as a good practice. More transparency in the grading or the oral questions were requested.
3) The project assignment and related data analysis was considered useful.
4) The course would be improved by including practical work in the laboratory.

Thank you for the feedback. All of the feedback (whether mentioned above or not) will be taken into account when planning the next implementation of the course.

We thank you for your participation to the course. The statistics to the first questions are visible to you.

The main issues considering the open questions were:

1) The methods of learning: 
The way that the Moodle was used was liked. Literature references that were provided in the weekly assignments were very useful and saved time. Some people liked the weekly assignments that were done before tutorial sessions because those taught self-learning skills. On the other hand, some people suggested that an orientation lecture or a group meeting in the beginning of the week could have helped the remote learning. Together the weekly assignments and the tutorial sessions were considered to expedite the learning process compared to traditional lectures. Laboratory visits and working in groups were appreciated. The videos in the ECHO were not liked; the system crashed often, videos were considered too long and had bad voice quality.

2) Projects assignment: 
Project assignment was found to complement the remote learning. The implementation of project work to the course schedule was criticized for demanding the use of knowledge that had not been taught yet. Instructions were found partly ambiguous. Some people suggested that project assignment should involve more data analysis and less scientific writing.

3) Assessment: 
The use of electronic exams was found practical but having one exam instead of two was suggested.

4) The quality of teaching was considered good. Lecturer and assistant were easy to contact.

Thank you for the feedback. All feedback, whether mentioned above or not, will be taken into account during the next implementation of the course.

We thank you for your participation to the course. The statistics to the first questions are visible to you.

The main issues considering the open questions were:

1) The method of learning:
Weekly learning assignments and assessments forced to work hard from the beginning of the course, which was found effective for learning but set more requirements for scheduling. Interactive learning process and direct feedback from the professor were generally liked. Some students would have preferred to get a short introduction to the next week’s subject at the end of the week. Laboratory visits and working in groups were appreciated. 

2) Projects assignment:
Project assignment was found useful in identification and teaching the core contents of the course. 
The project work was criticized for demanding a lot of time and effort. Instructions that are more specific were requested. It was said that if teams had consisted of students with similar background and performance level working in teams would have been a lot easier.
 
3) Assessment:
Weekly assessment and assessment based on performance were found useful for learning. However, it was also found more difficult to get the highest grade compared to a course where grading is based on only final exam. Some students criticized that continuous evaluation was found a bit arbitrary.

4) Continuous feedback and communication with the professor were appreciated.

Thank you for the feedback. All feedback, whether mentioned above or not, will be taken into account during the next implementation of the course.

We thank you for your participation. 

The statistics to the first questions are visible to you as graphs.

The main issues from the open questions were:

1) The course was considered to be interactive and this was generally found good. 
2) Tutorial sessions on Thursdays were also considered as a good practice.
3) The project assignment and related data analysis were considered useful.
4) The course would be improved by including practical work in the laboratory.
5) Some of the links to the literature were not working.

Thank you for the feedback. All of the feedback (whether mentioned above or not) will be taken into account when planning the next implementation of the course.

--

We thank you for your participation. 

The statistics to the first questions are visible to you as graphs.

The main issues from the open questions were:

1) The course was considered to be interactive and different in comparison with other MSc courses. 
2) Tutorial sessions on Thursdays activate students to study and learn the topics. However, the tutorial sessions were also considered to be stressful mainly due to the discussions.
3) The project assignment and related data analysis were considered useful and well organized.
4) Some of the links to the literature were not working and needs to be replaced.

Thank you for the feedback. All of the feedback (whether mentioned above or not) will be taken into account when planning the next implementation of the course.

We thank you for your participation. 

The statistics to the first questions are visible to you as graphs.

The main issues from the open questions were:

1) The course was considered to be well organized and blended learning method was liked. 
2) Tutorial sessions on Thursdays activate students to study and learn the topics. However, the course would be improved by including practical work in the laboratory.
3) Working in teams was considered useful.

Thank you for the feedback. All of the feedback (whether mentioned above or not) will be taken into account when planning the next implementation of the course.

Kiitos kaikille kurssipalautteesta, erityisesti kehittämisehdotuksista. Keskusteluihin kannattaa ilmeisesti panostaa jatkossakin, ja pitää miettiä olisiko jonkinlainen taltioiminen tai edes pääkohtien ylös kirjaaminen mahdollista. Arkkitehdillä on tietysti arkkitehdin näkökulma, mutta kyllä kurssilla on hyvä saada muitakin näkökulmia esille. Tulevaisuuteen katsominen on tärkeää, kiitos tästäkin kehittämisvinkistä.

Kiitos kaikille kurssilla mukana olleille sekä osallistumisesta että palautteesta. Olitte hienosti keskusteleva ja kysymyksiä asetteleva ryhmä, ja myös esittelykirjoitelmanne olivat kauttaaltaan hyviä ja aiheeseen paneutuvia. Oli mainiota, että olitte asettaneet itsellenne haasteita aihevalinnassakin: jo tuttujen kaupunkikirjoittajien kohdalla oli haettu uutta näkökulmaa ja aivan uudet tuttavuudet olivat vieneet ehkä vieraampien mutta erittäin kiinnostavien aihealueiden pariin. Opettajakin tässä oppi.
Thank you for the feedback - the course will be developed accordingly.

Thank you for your constructive and positive feedback.
For the upcoming implementations we will try get enough research topics already at the beginning of the course.

Thank you for your responses. According to those the course seems to be useful and productive. We try to develop the course so that will give more guidance and feedback to students during the course.

Have a jolly summer,
Jari Viik

Thank you all who have given responses. The course seems to be in excellent repair. The feedback after each duty will be regenerate for the next implementation. Amount of credits is a bit problematic for the course like this.

Thank you for your constructive and positive responses.
Jari

Thank for your feedback! According to the feedback the implementation of course went fine. The project topics were good and interesting. In a few projects there were too much workload. And some of you found the importance of statistical to be a minor for the project.

Best Wishes!
Jari

Hi all, 

Thanks for feedback and especially for the practical suggestions. I'll consult those when we arrange something like this again.

sanja

Dear students,

Thank you very much for your feedback! We appreciate your comments which are valuable in developing the course and its coming implementations. 

The feedback was given by four students. Generally, the feedback was very good. The overall rating of the course and its implementation was very high 4.5/5.0. The appropriateness of the course in relation to the intended learning outcomes was rated as 4.25/5.0 and the course workload corresponded well to the number of credits (2.0/3.0). According to the feedback, the course was well organized. The laboratory assignments and cleanroom training was a good practical experience for students. However, the COMSOL exercises should be improved and separated clearly from the other exercises of the course. The amount of educational material of the course implementation was too large. 

In the coming implementations, we will check the focus of the course to reduce of the lecture material. The exercises will be separated more clearly in the COMSOL and other exercises. Also the COMSOL modelling exercises will be developed according to the FEM background of the students.

This course is an introduction to the designing of micro sensors from many different points of view including the system theory. We hope that the students will participate in the coming implementations of the design of microsensors.

Best regards,

Teachers of the 2015 implementation: 
 
Jukka Lekkala
Ana Maria Soto de la Cruz
Haider Iftikhar

In general the students did very well on the course and seemed to be motivated. 

Based on your feedback, it will be considered for the following course implementations to clarify the POP course description to better reflect the content, workload and requirements for the course.

Thanks for your feedback! In overall your feedback was very positive and thus in overall the course arrangements seem to be fine. In particular, in the "Open answers" many of you gave positive remarks on the exercise sessions whose arrangements are thus likely not to change much. For this year's implementation some new activities were included into the inclass sessions, and since they were positively welcomed, similar new activities are planned for the next implementation.

Thank you for your feedback! 

Based on your feedback, most things in the course worked very well. For the next year, some modifications e.g. in the tasks of the course and in the order in which topics are covered are planned. Arrangements for the exercise sessions are kept the same as they seemed to worked well. Also, use of Comsol (to visualize features of EM problems) is continued.
Thanks for your feedback and for your good participation to the coursework! Your comments will be taken into account when planning the next course implementation.
Thank you for your feedback and comments during and after the course. The feedback will be taken into account when planning the next course implementation.
Thank you for your feedback and comments during and after the course. The feedback will be taken into account when planning the next course implementation.
Kiitos palautteesta. Palautteenne auttaa kehittämään kurssia.

Iso kiitos palautteen antajille. Kurssi pidettiin ensimmäistä kertaa, joten mukava kuulla, että se ei vaikuttanut turhalta ajanhukalta. Parannusehdotukset otetaan huomioon, ja katsotaan, jospa ajankohdallekin voisi tehdä jotain. Yritetään ainakin.

Kiitos kaikille kurssille osallistuneille ja palautetta antaneille. Mukava kuulla, että moni teistä kiinnostui yhdyskuntasuunnittelun teoriasta kurssin aikana. Vaikutti siltä, että osa sai kipinän myös lukemisen jatkamiseen, hienoa. Yritän ottaa jatkossa huomioon ajatuksellisesti vaativampaa sisältöä toivoneen kommentin - ymmärtävään pohdintaan on syytä kannustaa.
Erityinen kiitos kehittämisehdotuksista. Kurssikoosteen ohjeistusta pitänee jatkossa selkiyttää, ja jonkinlainen sanamäärähaarukka on varmaan hyvä olla. Ehdotuksenne kurssin tiukemmasta linkittämisestä YS-perusteisiin toteutunee, kun kursseja uusitaan lähitulevaisuudessa. 
Luennon korvaamista esseellä pidettiin työläänä. Ajatus oli, ettei siihen tarvitsisi käyttää aikaa juuri enempää kuin menetettyyn oppimistapahtumaankaan, eli tiedon hakemisesta ja esseen kirjoittamisesta olisi pitänyt suoriutua 2-3 tunnissa. Tätä on jatkossa varmaan syytä korostaa.
Pahoittelen, että kaikki eivät saaneet kotitehtävien esitysvuoroa joka kerralla. Moodleen laitettu lyhyt kommentti esityksestä ei tietysti korvannut esitystä ja kommentointia paikan päällä. Kurssille osallistujien suuri määrä yllätti. Ehdotus kotitehtävien ryhmäkoon kasvattamisesta on hyvä, otetaan käyttöön ensi kerralla. Ehkä isompi ryhmäkoko myös helpottaa tehtävien tekemisen työmäärää, jonka muutama kommentoija oli kokenut liian suureksi.

Kiitos kaikille palautetta antaneille. Kurssin kehittämisehdotuksenne antavat pohtimisen aihetta, ja ne pyritään ottamaan huomioon ensi vuoden kurssin suunnittelussa. Viikkotehtävien yhdistely voi olla hankalaa ilman kurssin rakenteen muutosta, mutta sitäkin voisi miettiä. Kurssikoosteen sisältöä tullaan käymään tarkemmin läpi kurssin kuluessa,aivan kuten ehdotitte. Ja ajankäyttöön kannattaa varmasti kiinnittää jatkossa huomiota.

Kiitos kaikille kurssille osallistuneille ja palautetta antaneille. Mukava kuulla, että mielenkiintonne yhdyskuntasuunnitteluun lisääntyi kurssin aikana. Kehittämisehdotuksenne yritän ottaa huomioon ensi vuoden kurssin suunnittelussa. Luennon korvaamista esseellä pidettiin työläänä. Ajatus oli alun perin, ettei siihen tarvitsisi käyttää aikaa juuri enempää kuin menetettyyn oppimistapahtumaankaan. Jatkossa on syytä selventää esseen vaatimuksia ja siihen mitoitettua aikaa.

Kiitos kaikille kurssille osallistuneille ja palautetta antaneille. Erityinen kiitos mainioista kehittämisehdotuksistanne. Toivottiin pidempiä ja perusteellisempia luentoja, ja lisää aikaa keskustelulle. Viikkotehtävien läpikäymisen taas toivottiin lyhenevän. Nykymuodossaan kurssi pidettiin nyt viimeistä kertaa, seuraava toteutuskerta onkin sitten 2 opintopistettä laajempi. Luennoille voinee silloin hyvinkin varata enemmän aikaa, samoin kuin keskustelulle. Yritän jatkossa myös kannustaa pontevammin viikon tekstien lukemiseen,jos vain keksin jonkun sopivan kannustimen. Hienosäätöä siis varmasti tapahtuu, vaikka kurssin perusrunko säilyisikin aiemman tapaisena.

As the instructor of this new course, I am welcoming all feedback. It is understandable that only 2 students have submitted their feedback, by 31 May 2015 (before actually passing the course). So far, 1 out of the 9 registered pioneering students has passed the course. Initially, Instructor's intent is to differentiate the content and requirements to some extent in the case of postgraduate/doctoral students and graduate/MSc students. 

Pekka Huovinen

Instructor welcomes all feedback to be given by participating students, either via the KAIKU system (n= 2) OR via the course’s own feedback form. So far, only the 2 (out of 19 registered) students have given the compulsory feedback via the KAIKU system by the closing date that Instructor had prolonged up to 10 April 2017. Regrettably, one Finnish student has written her or his feedback in Finnish. Nevertheless, this initial counter-feedback is related to this given feedback. Later, Instructor will complement and/or revise this counter feedback based on the students’ additional feedback (via the course’s form), combine the KAIKU feedback and the course’s own feedback, and upload this summary to Moodle system.

1. It seems that the current aims setting and content is too theoretical for MSc level students. In the coming academic years, it may be necessary to differentiate the content between and into two separate courses, one for MSc level students and the other for doctoral students.

2. Primarily, this course is planned based on the assumption that participants actually attend the six face-to-face sessions. There are no reasons for a change along this dimension of learning. Thus, learning only via on-line and off the class-room implies that such students will meet difficulties.

3. At the time, this course is the only course to be studies in English in the area of construction-related management. Understandably, this may imply that the expectations of participating students differ a lot of the learning aims of this course. In the future, more balanced learning would require that the Head (and Professors) of MSc study Programme will reverse the closing and exclusion of the old introductory, contextual course that preceded this highly theoretical one. In other words, the old course of RAK-53117 Contexts in International Construction Business (4-5 ECTS) should be re-included in the future curriculums, perhaps already during the next academic year 2017-2018.      

Hervanta, 11 April 2017

Pekka Huovinen
Course Instructor (and Examiner)
